original_title: Lower interest rate regime sustains stock market’s positive trend
original_body_lines: Stock market activities were extremely positive yesterday due to the growing lower interest rate regime in the country. This has given some impetus to local and foreign interests in the stock market, market analysts said.

Amid those developments, banking and financial, manufacturing, hotel and plantation sectors were performing well. All Share Price Index was up by 125.3 points while S and P SL20 rose by 32.1 points. Turnover stood at Rs 4.4 billion with eight crossings.

Those crossings were reported in Asia Asset Finance, which crossed 12.2 million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 223 million and its shares traded at Rs 13.20, Ambeon Capital 5.5 million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 125.9 million; its shares traded at Rs 22, JKH four million shares crossed for Rs 63.2 million; its shares traded at Rs 20.80, Associated Motor Finance 1.24 million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 37.9 million; its shares traded at Rs 30.50, Beruwela Resorts 5.2 million shares crossed for Rs 20.3 million; its shares traded at Rs 3.90, Sunshine Holdings 250,000 shares crossed for Rs 20.2 million and its shares sold at Rs 81, Sampath Bank 200,000 shares crossed for Rs 20.2 million; its shares traded at Rs 101.

In the retail market top seven companies that mainly contributed to the turnover were; Hayleys Rs 347 million (3.1 million shares traded), Agarapathana Plantations Rs 155 million (14.4 million shares traded), HNB Finance Rs 154 million (35.2 million shares traded), Beruwela Resorts Rs 146 million (36.6 million shares traded), Kotagala Plantations Rs 140 million (15.2 million shares traded) and LOLC Holdings Rs 136 million (286,000 shares traded). During the day 265 million share volumes changed hands in 31700 transactions.
Yesterday the rupee opened stronger at Rs 290.35/45 to the US dollar from 290.40/48 to the US dollar last Friday, dealers said, while bond yields were steady.

A bond maturing on 15.12.2027 was quoted at 10.05/15 percent, down from 10.10/20 percent. A bond maturing on 15.03.2028 was quoted stable at 10.40/50 percent. A bond maturing on 15.09.2029 was quoted stable at 10.80/90 percent.
